analyzed: rtsva sngon dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir rtsvar bcas te dor ro //
translated: One should place them on the ground together with the grass, because one enters into it together with the grass.üîΩWhat kind of ground?

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhe na bsil ba yang de nyid yin pas na bsil ba'i la phyogs te /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhe na bsil ba yang de nyid yin pas na bsil ba'i la phyogs te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin a cool place‚Äù is supplied.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i sa phyogs der mad ku ta gzhag par bya'i tshad pa la sogs pa dag tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i sa phyogs der mad ku ta gzhag par bya'i tshad pa la sogs pa dag tu ni ma yin no //
translated: One should place the nits on the ground in a place that is cool, not in a hot place, etc.

original: rtsvar bcas zhes smos pa ni tshad pas gdungs pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: rtsvar bcas zhes smos pa ni tshad pas gdungs pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútogether with the grass‚Äù is supplied in order to exclude the harm of heat, etc.

original: rtsva sngon dang bcas pa kho na zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsva sngon dang bcas pa kho na zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //

original: rtsva ni rtsa sngon po la bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva ni rtsa sngon po la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGrass‚Äù refers to green grass.

original: ji ltar shig la sogs pa de dag dor bar bya ba de bzhin du gzhan sprul la sogs pa gang yin pas gtum sogs zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar shig la sogs pa de dag dor bar bya ba de bzhin du gzhan sprul la sogs pa gang yin pas gtum sogs zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: Just as lice, etc. are to be discarded, so too are other things such as magical creations, etc.

original: sprul thog mar byas pa'i sdig pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni sbrul la sogs so //
analyzed: sprul thog mar byas pa'i sdig pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni sbrul la sogs so //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the sin of killing a magical creation, etc.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinguishing feature of these things?

original: gnod byed ces smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod byed ces smos pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúharmful‚Äù refers to this.

original: gnod pa de sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i phyir gnod byed yin la /
analyzed: gnod pa de sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i phyir gnod byed yin la /
translated: They are harmful because they cause harm, i.e., suffering.

original: de dag gi rang gi yul zhes bya ba yang gang dang gang gi rang gi spyod yul ma yin pa ste dper na sprul gyi ni grog mkhar lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi yul zhes bya ba yang gang dang gang gi rang gi spyod yul ma yin pa ste dper na sprul gyi ni grog mkhar lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin their own domain‚Äù means in a domain that is not their own, e.g., an anthill for a snake.

original: der so sor bskyal bar bya ste grol bar bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: der so sor bskyal bar bya ste grol bar bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: One should deliver them there, i.e., one should release them there.

original: sbyin pa gang gis shan bzung bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa gang gis shan bzung bas so //

original: da ni sngar bshad pa rjes su bstan par bya ba nyes @177b pa dang bcas pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sngar bshad pa rjes su bstan par bya ba nyes @177b pa dang bcas pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the teaching that was mentioned above together with its faults, he says:

original: tha ma 'di ni zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: tha ma 'di ni zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The last one is called the ‚Äúfinal one.‚Äù

original: 'di tha ma yin pa'i phyir tha ma ste mi gzhan yin la gang gis mir 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mar gyur pa'i nyes pa bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di tha ma yin pa'i phyir tha ma ste mi gzhan yin la gang gis mir 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mar gyur pa'i nyes pa bstan pa yin la /
translated: Because it is the final one, it is the final one, i.e., another person. The fault of becoming the final one is taught by ‚Äúhe who thinks he is a human being,‚Äù etc.

original: de yang nyes byas te 'khrul pa med cing gsod pa'i sems yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang bcas te bshad pa yin te bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyes byas te 'khrul pa med cing gsod pa'i sems yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang bcas te bshad pa yin te bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that is explained as being associated with a fault, i.e., a mistake, and with the thought of killing, etc. Explanation is the explanation.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni phyis kyang srog gcod pa ste srog chags gsod par byed pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni phyis kyang srog gcod pa ste srog chags gsod par byed pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa bshad par bya ba ste /
translated: Now, the killing of a living being, i.e., the killing of a living creature, which is later, i.e., subsequent to the final one, should be explained.

original: yid kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be taught that it is a fault of the mind. This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i don to //

original: phyogs su gtogs pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs su gtogs pa de dag gang zhe na /

original: nad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /

original: nad pa ni nad kyis nyon mongs par gyur pa yin te de dag la'o //
analyzed: nad pa ni nad kyis nyon mongs par gyur pa yin te de dag la'o //

original: dug dang mtshon ni dug dang mtshon yin te /
analyzed: dug dang mtshon ni dug dang mtshon yin te /
translated: Poison and weapons are poison and weapons.

original: de sbyin pa dang / de bzhin du btung ba la sogs pa mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni btung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de sbyin pa dang / de bzhin du btung ba la sogs pa mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni btung ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'o //
translated: That which is not suitable as food, drink, etc. is unsuitable as food, drink, etc.

original: mthun pa ni phan zhing 'phrod pa yin la /
analyzed: mthun pa ni phan zhing 'phrod pa yin la /
translated: That which is suitable is suitable and beneficial.

original: mi mthun pa ni mi 'phrod pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni mi 'phrod pa ste /
translated: That which is not suitable is unsuitable.

original: de sbyin par byed pa ni yang dag par sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de sbyin par byed pa ni yang dag par sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To give that is called giving what is suitable.

original: gal te nad pa tshor bas gzir ba zhig dug gam mtshon slong ba de'i tshe bsam pa dang sems dag pas de phyin na kha na ma tho ba med do zhes shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te nad pa tshor bas gzir ba zhig dug gam mtshon slong ba de'i tshe bsam pa dang sems dag pas de phyin na kha na ma tho ba med do zhes shes par bya zhing /
translated: If a sick person, tormented by feeling, asks for poison or a weapon, then if he gives it to him with a pure intention and mind, he is not at fault.

original: bzlog pas ni rtsa ba'i nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur te de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pas ni rtsa ba'i nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur te de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: But if he does not give it, he incurs a root downfall. The rest should be understood as above.

original: nad pa la sman ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: nad pa la sman ji ltar sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: How should medicine be given to the sick?

original: rgan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rgan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The verse text says, ‚ÄúThe wise should not give medicine to the sick in inappropriate ways.‚Äù

original: rgan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of elders:

original: na sos dang / bslab pas so //
analyzed: na sos dang / bslab pas so //
translated: those who are elders in terms of seniority and those who are elders in terms of moral discipline.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between them?

original: mkhas pa ste nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ste nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa la'o //
translated: The wise should not give medicine to the sick in inappropriate ways.

original: na'i sgra ni de lta bur gyur pa de la dris pa nyid kyis zhes nges par gzung ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni de lta bur gyur pa de la dris pa nyid kyis zhes nges par gzung ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúonly to those who are sick‚Äù is meant to be understood as referring to those who are elders in terms of seniority.

original: sman pa dang zhes bya ba'i dang ni rim pa gzhan sdud pa'i don yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩnad pa nad kyis nyon mongs par gyur pa la sman rjes su sbyin par bya'i /
analyzed: sman pa dang zhes bya ba'i dang ni rim pa gzhan sdud pa'i don yin par blta bar bya'o // nad pa nad kyis nyon mongs par gyur pa la sman rjes su sbyin par bya'i /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúand to those who are elders in terms of moral discipline‚Äù should be understood to include other categories.üîΩMedicine should be given to the sick, but not to those who are not sick.

original: de lta de lta bu nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta de lta bu nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It should be given to those who are elders in terms of moral discipline, but not to those who are not elders in terms of moral discipline.

original: de'i nad g-yog glen las zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i nad g-yog glen las zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: The verse text says, ‚ÄúThe wise should not give medicine to the sick in inappropriate ways.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nad pa la la dug la sogs pa sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du glen pa ste @178a * //
analyzed: ji ltar nad pa la la dug la sogs pa sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du glen pa ste @178a * //
translated: Just as medicine should not be given to the sick in inappropriate ways, in the same way, the wise should not give medicine to the foolish in inappropriate ways.

original: rmongs par gyur pa phan pa dang mi phan pa mi shes pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rmongs par gyur pa phan pa dang mi phan pa mi shes pa dag yin no //
translated: They are ignorant, not knowing what is beneficial and what is not beneficial.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i nad g-yog bsnyen bkur bar mi bsko ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i nad g-yog bsnyen bkur bar mi bsko ste /

original: gang gi phyir 'dis bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa shes pa ma yin no //
translated: because he does not know what should be done and what should not be done.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad du bsko bar mi bya'am zhe na /üîΩmed na zhes smos pa yin te yod pa ni mkhas pa yod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad du bsko bar mi bya'am zhe na / med na zhes smos pa yin te yod pa ni mkhas pa yod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Is he never to be appointed?üîΩThe root text states, ‚Äúif there is no other choice.‚Äù If there is a choice, then a skilled person is to be appointed.

original: yod pa ma yin pa ni de med pa dang mi snang na zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni de med pa dang mi snang na zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //

translated: If he is foolish, then he is to be instructed and trained in what should be done and what should not be done. He is to be appointed only if he can be instructed and trained.

original: nad pa la ni de lta'i chos ma brjod ces bya ba ni chos ma yin yang chos kyi sgras brjod cing rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir gang gis chos brjod pas de'i sems 'chi ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nad pa la ni de lta'i chos ma brjod ces bya ba ni chos ma yin yang chos kyi sgras brjod cing rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir gang gis chos brjod pas de'i sems 'chi ba'i phyir te /

original: 'chi ba'i don du sems skye ba ni 'chi ba'i phyir nges par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i don du sems skye ba ni 'chi ba'i phyir nges par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdeath‚Äù is that the mind is born for the sake of death. The meaning of ‚Äúdefinitely‚Äù is that it is certain.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i chos nad pa'i mdun du mi brjod pa ste smra bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i chos nad pa'i mdun du mi brjod pa ste smra bar bya ba ma yin no //

original: 'di ltar nad pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar nad pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /

analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa la yang ji srid 'tsho zhing gnas par gyur pa de srid lus can sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing 'chi ba ni mtho ris la sogs pa bde ba dang bsod nams mang zhing sdig pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa nad

analyzed: pa la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yang ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /

analyzed: yun ring du srog 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: don du na de nyid rnam grangs yin no //

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dge ba'i tshig gi rnam pa de la brjod par bya'i rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don du rnam grangs kyi tshig brjod pa yin gyi /

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dun rnam grangs kyi tshig don med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /

original: bder gyur ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bder gyur ces bya ba smos pa yin te /

original: bde bar gyur pa ni bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa'o //

translated: Therefore, the fear of disease is the fear of disease.

analyzed: ji srid ring du ste dus ring por 'tsho bar gyur pa de srid du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //

original: ji ltar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi bya zhe na /

analyzed: gdol ba bzhin du zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: gang gi phyir brtse ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtse ba ste /
translated: Because of lack of affection.

analyzed: de'i bus shes par ma gyur kyang de ni de nyid kyi yin te de'i bu yin pa'i phyir la 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes des bdag gir byas pa ni ma yin te mi shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

translated: When the root is cut, even though the king is the owner, he does not appropriate it, and it is excluded in this way.

original: mang po'i tshig ni gzhan dang gzhan dag gis kyang bdag gir byas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni gzhan dang gzhan dag gis kyang bdag gir byas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The plural in the phrase ‚Äúby others and others‚Äù is stated to indicate that it is appropriated by others.

original: 'dod pa de nyid ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa de nyid ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gang gi phyir gzhan brku bar bya'o snyam pa las cig shos brkus par gyur chung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan brku bar bya'o snyam pa las cig shos brkus par gyur chung bar 'gyur la /

original: de nyid brkus par gyur na rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid brkus par gyur na rtsa bar 'gyur ro zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one steals the right object, one‚Äôs sin is great. This is the teaching.

original: dper na dkar po brku bar bya'o snyam pa'am //üîΩ'di che ge mo zhig gi yin no zhes ma bsams par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis brkus par gyur tam /
analyzed: dper na dkar po brku bar bya'o snyam pa'am // 'di che ge mo zhig gi yin no zhes ma bsams par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis brkus par gyur tam /
translated: For example, it is like the case of someone who thinks, ‚ÄúI will steal the white one,‚ÄùüîΩbut due to confusion, without thinking, ‚ÄúThis belongs to so and so,‚Äù he steals it.üîΩ

original: sbyor ba tsam bya'o snyam du shes pas gal te len par mi byed na chung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyor ba tsam bya'o snyam du shes pas gal te len par mi byed na chung bar 'gyur la /

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa de nyid ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di nyid rtsa bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa de nyid ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di nyid rtsa bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: If it is not so, then it is a root downfall, as it is said, ‚Äúwith that very intention.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis ma bsams pa ma yin pa la ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon yon tan 'od kyis ma bsams pa ma yin pa la ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: de la dur khrod pa dang mi dbang bsod snyoms gzhan zhes bya bas ni dur khrod pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dur khrod pa dang mi dbang bsod snyoms gzhan zhes bya bas ni dur khrod pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúcemetery dweller, one who lives on alms, and another‚Äù excludes the cemetery dweller, etc.

original: ci 'di ni phyis rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci 'di ni phyis rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: This should be analyzed later.

original: mi yir 'du shes zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi yir 'du shes zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it said, ‚Äúwith the perception that it is a human being‚Äù?

original: gang gi phyir mi gzhan gyi nor yin la mis kyang bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag yod par gyur na 'di ni mi'i yin gyi dud 'gro la sogs pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gzhan gyi nor yin la mis kyang bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag yod par gyur na 'di ni mi'i yin gyi dud 'gro la sogs pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: If the other person's wealth is owned by a human and so on, then it is the human's wealth and not the animal's.üîΩBut if the other person does not own it, then it is not a downfall.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig gis bdag gir ma byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'du shes @182b gang yin pa de med na mthar ni mi 'gyur gyi 'di ltar nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi yir 'du shes brjod pa yin no /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig gis bdag gir ma byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'du shes @182b gang yin pa de med na mthar ni mi 'gyur gyi 'di ltar nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi yir 'du shes brjod pa yin no /
translated: To indicate that it is not a downfall if the other person does not own it, the term human is used.

original: gzhan gyi rdzas rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de la rku sems nyid yod pa kho na yin na ci'i phyir 'di smos she na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de la rku sems nyid yod pa kho na yin na ci'i phyir 'di smos she na /

analyzed: 'di la gdon mi za bar rku sems nyid yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes nges pa ni med de /

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig tu bdag nyid kyi bsam pas 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig tu bdag nyid kyi bsam pas 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes pa'am /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu dus de srid cig las phyir yang bzlog par bya'o snyam pa'am /

original: sbyor ba gcig pa yi zhes ci'i phyir brjod de gang gi phyir sbyor ba du mas ma sbyor ba gcig gis na na ga'i bzhi cha brkus par gyur na dngos gzhir byed pa kho na brkus pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig pa yi zhes ci'i phyir brjod de gang gi phyir sbyor ba du mas ma sbyor ba gcig gis na na ga'i bzhi cha brkus par gyur na dngos gzhir byed pa kho na brkus pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Because if one steals a quarter of a nƒÅli by one performance, but not by many performances, then it is only the actual basis that is stealing.üîΩThat is true, but if one steals by many performances, then it is a fault of many performances, but not the actual basis.

original: bden te 'on kyang sbyor ba du mas rku bar byed na sbyor ba du ma'i nyes byas su 'gyur gyi dngos gzhi ni ma yin la gang gi tshe sbyor ba gcig gis rin thang tshang ba brkus pa de'i tshe 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang sbyor ba du mas rku bar byed na sbyor ba du ma'i nyes byas su 'gyur gyi dngos gzhi ni ma yin la gang gi tshe sbyor ba gcig gis rin thang tshang ba brkus pa de'i tshe 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di
translated: But when one steals the full value by one performance, then it is.

original: brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is statedüîΩin order to teach that.

original: bdag gi phyir zhes pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gi phyir zhes pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it for one's own sake?

original: gang gi phyir rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de la des pa kho nar rang gi don yin par 'di la nges pa med do /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de la des pa kho nar rang gi don yin par 'di la nges pa med do /
translated: Because it is not certain that the one who steals for his own sake will definitely benefit himself.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi don nam chud gzan pa'i phyir rku bar byed pa srid pa yin pas de'i phyir gzhan gyi don du rku bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur la /

original: chud gzan pa yang phrogs te /
analyzed: chud gzan pa yang phrogs te /

original: chud gzan pa ni chung ngur 'gyur zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba de bas na bdag gi phyir zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chud gzan pa ni chung ngur 'gyur zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba de bas na bdag gi phyir zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Since it is said, Wasting is a minor offense, one should say for one's own sake.

original: gnas dang dus de'i rin thang dbang gis bskrad //
analyzed: gnas dang dus de'i rin thang dbang gis bskrad //
translated: One is expelled for the value of the place and time.

original: ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it said?

original: gnas gzhan la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas gzhan la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir te /

original: gnas gang dang dus gang la brkus pa'i gnas dang dus de'i rin thang gang yin pa de'i dbang gis nyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnas gang dang dus gang la brkus pa'i gnas dang dus de'i rin thang gang yin pa de'i dbang gis nyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One is expelled for the value of the place and time at which one steals.

original: dus gzhan la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the power of time, etc.

original: de la 'dir rang gi gnas dang dus de'i rin thang gis dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la 'dir rang gi gnas dang dus de'i rin thang gis dngos gzhir 'gyur la /

original: ci ste ma yin na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma yin na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If it is not so, then it is a minor offense.

original: dad pas rgyal ba'i ring bsrel brkus de min //
analyzed: dad pas rgyal ba'i ring bsrel brkus de min //
translated: One who steals the relics of the Victor through faith is not.

original: zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /üîΩdad @183a * //
analyzed: zhes ci'i phyir smos she na / dad @183a * //
translated: Why is this said?

original: pa ma yin par 'tsho ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi ring bsrel brkus na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde la brku ba la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag ma lus pas ni dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: pa ma yin par 'tsho ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyi ring bsrel brkus na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro // de la brku ba la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag ma lus pas ni dngos gzhir 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is said in order to show that if one steals the relics of the Blessed One for the sake of livelihood, but not through faith, then it is a basic transgression.

original: yan lag ma tshang bas na nyes par 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba ston par byed /
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang bas na nyes par 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba ston par byed /
translated: In this regard, the verse, ‚ÄúIn stealing, etc.,‚Äù teaches that one becomes guilty of a basic transgression by all the limbs, and that one does not become guilty by incomplete limbs.

original: de la rku sems kyi dngos po ni rku sems nyid de'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de la rku sems kyi dngos po ni rku sems nyid de'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: In this regard, the object of stealing is the primary cause of the thought of stealing.

original: gang la zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gang la zhe na smras pa /

original: gzhan gyi rdzas rku zhing 'phrog pa la zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir gcig po de nyid dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas rku zhing 'phrog pa la zhes bya ba lhag ma'o // gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa de'i phyir gcig po de nyid dang bral ba ste /

original: med na dngos gzhi'am sbyor ba'i nyes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na dngos gzhi'am sbyor ba'i nyes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because this is so, therefore, if one of these is absent, there is no offense of the actual basis or of preparation.

original: kho na'i sgra ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
analyzed: kho na'i sgra ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i don to //

analyzed: 'di skad du yan lag lhag ma thams cad yod kyang gcig po 'di nyid med na nyes pa med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

original: gal te sbyor ba'i gnas skabs skabs na rang gi bsam pa la sogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir rku sems med na dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su ni rang gi bsam pa la sogs pa ldog pa de bas na dngos gzhir 'gyur la bzlog pas ni sbyor ba'i nyes par
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba'i gnas skabs skabs na rang gi bsam pa la sogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir rku sems med na dngos gzhi'i gnas skabs su ni rang gi bsam pa la sogs pa ldog pa de bas na dngos gzhir 'gyur la bzlog pas ni sbyor ba'i nyes par
translated: If there is no thought of stealing in the situation of preparation, because one is engaged in one‚Äôs own thoughts, and so on, then in the situation of the actual basis, one‚Äôs own thoughts, and so on, are reversed. Therefore, it is the actual basis. If they are reversed, it is the offense of preparation.

original: 'gyur gyi de dngos gzhi ni ma yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur gyi de dngos gzhi ni ma yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is not the actual basis.

original: rku sems las gzhan pa lhag ma de dag ni yan lag lhag ma ste lhag ma yang de yin la yan lag kyang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rku sems las gzhan pa lhag ma de dag ni yan lag lhag ma ste lhag ma yang de yin la yan lag kyang yin pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang med pa dang mi snang ba zhes bya ba don gcig pa yin pa de'i yan lag lhag ma dang mi ldan pa ni med pa nyid yin te nyes byas chung ngur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang med pa dang mi snang ba zhes bya ba don gcig pa yin pa de'i yan lag lhag ma dang mi ldan pa ni med pa nyid yin te nyes byas chung ngur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Not possessing those, not having, not appearing, are synonyms. Not possessing the remaining limbs is not having, so it is a minor offense.

original: 'di skad du yan lag lhag ma dag las gzhan 'ga' zhig ni med kyang rkus mas yod ni na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du yan lag lhag ma dag las gzhan 'ga' zhig ni med kyang rkus mas yod ni na chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that if one does not have any of the remaining limbs, but has the thought of stealing, it is a minor offense.

original: ni'i sgra ni gong ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gong ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù is for the purpose of distinguishing from the previous.

original: rku sems dang bral ba 'ba' zhig gis nyes pa med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rku sems dang bral ba 'ba' zhig gis nyes pa med pa ma yin gyi /

original: 'on kyang gzhan dag la yang 'gyur te gang gi phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa rmi lam ma yin pa bslab pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba de dag rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs zhes smos pa yin te /

translated: Those who are not dreamers are called ‚Äúdreamers, etc.,‚ÄùüîΩbecause they are included in the category of dreamers, etc.

original: rmi lam dang por byas pa gang yin pa de ni rmi lam la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam dang por byas pa gang yin pa de ni rmi lam la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who are not dreamers are called ‚Äúdreamers, etc.,‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras bshad ma thag pa sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bshad ma thag pa sdud par byed do //
translated: because they are included in the category of dreamers, etc.

original: de la rmi lam la @183b sogs pa la nyes pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rmi lam la @183b sogs pa la nyes pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, dreamers, etc., are not at fault,

original: nyes byas su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: because they do not commit an offense.

original: 'dir ji ltar rku sems med na yan lag lhag ma thams cad yod kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rmi lam la sogs pa 'di la yang gang yang rung ba re re med na gzhan yod kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar rku sems med na yan lag lhag ma thams cad yod kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar rmi lam la sogs pa 'di la yang gang yang rung ba re re med na gzhan yod kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par
translated: Here, just as when there is no thought of stealing, one does not commit an offense even if all the other conditions are present, so too, in this case of dreamers, etc., one does not commit an offense even if the other conditions are present, if any one of them is absent.

original: bya'o // ni'i sgra ni rmi lam la sogs pa nam yang nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes nges par gzung ba'o //üîΩda ni dang po sems bskyed pa la bsdam par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bya'o // ni'i sgra ni rmi lam la sogs pa nam yang nyes pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes nges par gzung ba'o // da ni dang po sems bskyed pa la bsdam par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the possibility of any fault in dreams, etc.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad kyi gnas skabs gang la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur ba de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad kyi gnas skabs gang la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur ba de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to explain the occasion for all the rules of training, he says, ‚ÄúFirst, one should restrain the mind, etc.‚Äù

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni 'das pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i sems gang yin pa de skyed pa ste 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid kyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni 'das pa thams cad kyi sbyor ba thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i sems gang yin pa de skyed pa ste 'di dang 'di bya'o zhes nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid kyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The first is the mind that engages in all the preparations for all the past [actions]. It is generated, i.e., the mental conception ‚ÄúI will do this and that‚Äù arises.

original: de la de lta bur gyur pa'i sems bskyed pa ni yid kho nas bsdam par bya zhing phyir gso bar rigs pa'i phyir bsdam par bya ba ste yid kyi kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de lta bur gyur pa'i sems bskyed pa ni yid kho nas bsdam par bya zhing phyir gso bar rigs pa'i phyir bsdam par bya ba ste yid kyi kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The generation of such a mind should be restrained by the mind itself, because it is proper to restore [the mind] to its natural state. Thus, it is to be restrained, i.e., it becomes a mental offense.

original: gang zhig rku ba la sogs pa'i don gyi sbyor ba brku bar bya ba'i rdzas 'dren par byed pa la sogs pa'i phyir sngar ldang ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba ni sbyor ba yin pa de'i phyir sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kho
analyzed: gang zhig rku ba la sogs pa'i don gyi sbyor ba brku bar bya ba'i rdzas 'dren par byed pa la sogs pa'i phyir sngar ldang ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bya ba ni sbyor ba yin pa de'i phyir sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kho
translated: Because preparation is the action of rising, going and so on for the purpose of stealing and so forth, such as leading the stolen object to the destination, then preparation is a misdeed.üîΩ

original: na ste bshags par bya ba nyid du shes shing khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: na ste bshags par bya ba nyid du shes shing khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The preparation is the action of rising, going, etc. for the purpose of stealing, etc. and for the sake of bringing the stolen goods, etc. Therefore, one should understand and comprehend that only a misdeed is incurred in the preparation.

analyzed: nyid ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //

analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yin la de la yang nyes byas nyid du 'gyur gyi sbyor ba 'ba' zhig la ni ma yin no //

original: yang gi sgra ni gang zhig rku ba'i don gyi sbyor ba brku bar bya ba'i rdzas 'dren pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni gang zhig rku ba'i don gyi sbyor ba brku bar bya ba'i rdzas 'dren pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that a misdeed is incurred in the nature of bringing the stolen goods, etc. for the purpose of stealing, etc.

original: dang gi sgra ni bshad zin pa'i sgra sdud pa yin la nyid ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni bshad zin pa'i sgra sdud pa yin la nyid ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa kun la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa kun la'o //

analyzed: rtsa ba nyid ni srog gcod pa rjes su sgrub par byad pa yin la /

original: gzhan yang brku bar bya ba'i rdzas gnas nas skrod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir rtsa ba nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang brku bar bya ba'i rdzas gnas nas skrod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir rtsa ba nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur te /

original: dang po'i bzhi po sdom pa 'jig par byed pa dang / gzhan bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhi nyid du 'gyur @184a * //
analyzed: dang po'i bzhi po sdom pa 'jig par byed pa dang / gzhan bshags par bya ba'i dngos gzhi nyid du 'gyur @184a * //

original: ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdper na 'ga' zhig gis spyod lam bzhi po dag las gang yang rung bas 'dug ste /
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba'i don to // dper na 'ga' zhig gis spyod lam bzhi po dag las gang yang rung bas 'dug ste /

analyzed: rku ba'i phyir rnam par rtog par byed pa de las yid kyir 'gyur la /
translated: For example, if someone sits in any of the four modes of behavior and conceptualizes in order to steal, then it is mental.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jug par byed cing ji srid nom par mi byed nyug par mi byed kyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i 'og tu yang gnas nas gnas su sbed par byed pa de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur la /

translated: Then, if he does not examine it or touch it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.üîΩIf he conceals it from one place to another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnas nas bskyed pa na rtsa bar 'gyur te /

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang blta bar bya'o //

original: ji ltar yang /
analyzed: ji ltar yang /

original: yan lag lhag ma mi ldan chung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma mi ldan chung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes spyir nyes pa chung ngur 'gyur ba bstan pa de ltar yang phrogs te par mi byed kyi bar ma tshang ba'i spros pa ston par byed de /

analyzed: bshags par bya ba kho na'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he conceals it, he commits a serious offense.üîΩIf he moves it from its base, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: nyid ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i don to //

analyzed: rgya ni gang gis chu las nya 'don par byed pa ste / de la sogs pa de lta bu'i rigs can gang yin pa de ni rgya la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'khrul 'khor ni ri dag sa la sogs pa gsad pa'i phyir shing gi sbyor bdag yin no //

original: dang ni sdud par byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: dang ni sdud par byed pa'i don yin no //

analyzed: 'di la chud gzan pa'i bsam pa nyid yod pa'i phyir rku sems kyang med la bdag gi phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: Here, there is no intention to steal, nor is it for one's own sake, because there is only the intention to set a trap.

original: mi dbang bsod snyoms yongs su blangs gyur na //
analyzed: mi dbang bsod snyoms yongs su blangs gyur na //
translated: Having accepted alms from the lord of men,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phrog par byed pa ste /

original: de la yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro //

original: nyid ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: kyang gi sgra ni g-yos su byas pa'i zas rin thang tshang du zin kyang chung ba kho na yin no zhes khyad par du bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni g-yos su byas pa'i zas rin thang tshang du zin kyang chung ba kho na yin no zhes khyad par du bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is for the purpose of specifying that the food that is prepared is of little value.

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'jig rten tha snyad tshul gyis zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten tha snyad tshul gyis zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúin accordance with worldly conventions.‚Äù

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi tshul ni 'jig rten tha snyad tshul yin pa de bas na des so //
translated: The way of worldly conventions is the way of worldly conventions. Therefore, it is by that.

translated: Because, in the world, there is no apprehension of food that is prepared in the same way as there is of a nƒÅka coin, therefore, it is not supreme or special. Thus, the idea of stealing does not arise in the world with regard to it.

analyzed: de bas na mis bdag gir byes pa dang rin thang tshang ba med pa'i phyir mi yis bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba 'di la med pas nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not appropriated by a person and does not have a full price, it is called ‚Äúappropriated by a person‚Äù and is of little demerit.

original: mi dbang zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dbang zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa yin te /

original: de bas na don 'di ni dbang ba ma yin pa'i bsod snyoms te 'jig rten pa'i brnyas pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir snying brtse ba'i blo ni mi skye ba de bas na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na don 'di ni dbang ba ma yin pa'i bsod snyoms te 'jig rten pa'i brnyas pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir snying brtse ba'i blo ni mi skye ba de bas na nyes pa chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this meaning is that alms are not controlled, and since they are the object of contempt by the world, the mind of compassion does not arise. Therefore, it is said to be of little demerit.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig gis dus de srid cig gos la sogs pa byin pa ltos pa med par longs spyad na cir 'gyur ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig gis dus de srid cig gos la sogs pa byin pa ltos pa med par longs spyad na cir 'gyur ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To show what happens when one uses without regard for the time limit some alms given for that period, it is said:

analyzed: gzhan gos gtan du byin ltar spyod pa dang zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /

analyzed: gos dag gtan du byin pa'i tshul gang yin pa ste de lta bu des so //

original: gzhan dag gos yongs su longs spyod pa ni de la zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gos yongs su longs spyod pa ni de la zhen pa yin te /

original: gzhan dag gi gos longs spyad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi gos longs spyad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one enjoys the use of another's clothing, one commits an offense.

original: dang ni rim pa gzhan sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dang ni rim pa gzhan sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù includes another alternative.

original: 'di skad du dus de srid cig rnyed pa la rnam pa thams cad du rnyed pa yongs su longs spyad pa ltar 'gyod pa med cing ltos pa med par spyod par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du dus de srid cig rnyed pa la rnam pa thams cad du rnyed pa yongs su longs spyad pa ltar 'gyod pa med cing ltos pa med par spyod par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it teaches: If one uses clothing without regret and without regard for how long it takes to obtain it, as if one had obtained it in every way, one commits an offense.

original: mi rigs par spyod pas snying po len par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rigs par spyod pas snying po len par byed pa yin gyi /

analyzed: ci zhig kyang brkus pa ni med pa'i phyir rku sems dang rku ba'i yan lag gzhan dag kyang med la bsam pa ni ngan par gyur ba yin no //
translated: But since one does not steal anything, there is no thought of stealing and no other branches of stealing, and the attitude is bad.

analyzed: sman dang sngags ni sman dang sngags te de dag gis kyang gos la sogs pa sbyin du 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Medicines and mantras are medicines and mantras. If one uses them to obtain clothing, etc., one commits an offense.

original: kyang gi sgra ni sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is a particle that indicates inclusion.

original: dper na sngags kyi sbyor ba dang gzhan ma gu bar bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa me tog la sogs pa byin pas sbyin du 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //

translated: For example, if one makes another person give flowers, etc. as a means of pleasing others, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, even though one does not oneself engage in giving.

original: sbyin pa po de la bdag nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa la 'jug pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa po de la bdag nyid 'dod pas sbyin pa la 'jug pa ni med kyi /
translated: One does not engage in giving out of desire for oneself, but

analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ltar sngags la sogs pa'i dbang ngam stobs kyi rnam pas 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir rku sems nyid ni med de /

analyzed: 'di ltar log pa'i 'tsho ba ni yin pa de'i phyir ma byin par len par gtogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since this is so, it is not the case that one commits the offense of taking what is not given.

original: 'dod pa ni mngon par @185a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mngon par @185a * //
translated: Desire means that which is intended.

original: bsams pa ste de rku ba ni 'dod pa rku ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa ste de rku ba ni 'dod pa rku ba'o //
translated: Stealing that is, taking what is not given is stealing desire.

original: de'i phyir mang po'i nang du rnam par 'byed par byed cing tha dad par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mang po'i nang du rnam par 'byed par byed cing tha dad par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one divides and separates in the midst of a group, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: 'dod pa brku bar bya'o snyam pas mang po'i nang nas rnam par 'byed par byed kyi /

analyzed: gnas nas skyod par mi byed na yang nyes byas yin gyi /
translated: but does not move it from its base, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dangs gzhir ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dangs gzhir ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: But it is not a basis.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa gnas las skyod par byed pa de'i tshe dngos gzhir 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa gnas las skyod par byed pa de'i tshe dngos gzhir 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When one moves the desired object from its base, then it becomes a basis.

original: gzhan gyi don ni gzhan don te de'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni gzhan don te de'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of another means for the sake of another's aim.

original: don gyi sgra ni dgos pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: don gyi sgra ni dgos pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The term artha means purpose.

original: len cing blangs la 'gyed pa ste rnam par 'god na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len cing blangs la 'gyed pa ste rnam par 'god na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts and distributes, or arranges, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang ni sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The term ca is a conjunction.

original: dper na gzhan gyis khyed cag gis 'di dang che ge mo la mchod ston la sogs pa 'di dang 'di gyis shig ces gzhan gyi lag tu byin pa dang de dag gis de yang blangs nas 'god par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyis khyed cag gis 'di dang che ge mo la mchod ston la sogs pa 'di dang 'di gyis shig ces gzhan gyi lag tu byin pa dang de dag gis de yang blangs nas 'god par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don
translated: For example, if one says to another, You should do this and that for the sake of this and that feast and so on, and if one gives it into the hands of another, and if they accept it and distribute it, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: to // 'di ji ltar na nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: to // 'di ji ltar na nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be a minor offense?

original: gang gi phyir mi gzhan gyi nor yang yin la rku sems kyang yod pa'i phyir dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gzhan gyi nor yang yin la rku sems kyang yod pa'i phyir dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is the property of another and there is the thought of stealing, it would be a basic transgression.

analyzed: smras pa / mi yis bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gir byas pa nyid 'di la med do // gang gi phyir che ge mo la mchod ston la sogs pa gyis shig ces de gang la bstabs pa des bdag la mchod ston gyi phyir byin pa yin no zhes 'di mi shes la /
translated: We say: This is not the property of another, because it is not recognized as such by anyone.üîΩBecause he does not know that it is given to him by someone who says, ‚ÄúMake an offering of this to such and such a person,‚Äù and that person does not know that it is given to him by the one who says, ‚ÄúMake an offering of this to such and such a person.‚Äù

original: gang gis byin pa des kyang yongs su spangs pa de'i phyir 'gas kyang bdag gir ma byas pa yin no /
analyzed: gang gis byin pa des kyang yongs su spangs pa de'i phyir 'gas kyang bdag gir ma byas pa yin no /
translated: Because it is not recognized by anyone, it is not the property of anyone.

original: de ltar na yang dngos su bdag po dang bcas pa kho na yin yang bdag pos mi shes pa'i sgo nas bdag po dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //

translated: Thus, although it is the property of another in fact, it should be understood that it is a minor offense because it is not the property of another from the perspective of the owner not recognizing it.

original: 'ged pa smos pa ni mang po'i dbang du byas pa yin pa de'i phyir gcig gis blangs su zin kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ged pa smos pa ni mang po'i dbang du byas pa yin pa de'i phyir gcig gis blangs su zin kyang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The mention of distribution is from the perspective of many. Therefore, even if one person takes it, it becomes a minor offense.

original: phyogs bzhi gang la yod pa de ni phyogs bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi gang la yod pa de ni phyogs bzhi pa'o //
translated: The four directions is that which exists in the four directions.

original: de dag gi tshogs ni phyogs bzhi pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs ni phyogs bzhi pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The assembly of those is the assembly of the four directions.

original: phyogs bzhi pa'i tshogs de'i 'phags pa'i tshogs ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun gyi dkor ro //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi pa'i tshogs de'i 'phags pa'i tshogs ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun gyi dkor ro //
translated: The wealth of the assembly of the four directions is the wealth of the noble Sangha.

original: phyogs bzhi'i don du brkus na chung ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i don du brkus na chung ba ste /
translated: If one steals for the sake of the four directions, it is minor.

original: nyes byas chung ngur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: When one sees with one‚Äôs own eyes the goods of another, such as a treasure, that are to be stolen, then the act of stealing is complete.

analyzed: nyid ni gnas gzhan du spos pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag ni ma yin no zhes rnam par dpyod pa'i don to //

analyzed: 'di ltar rku ba po ni spyings nas phyis brku bar bya'o snyam pa ma yin nam zhe na /

analyzed: de lta ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan gas gtan du byin ltar spyod pa dang // sman dang sngags kyis kyang ni sbyin du 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: and one should give by means of medicine and mantra.

original: gang kho na las bsdus she na ;
analyzed: gang kho na las bsdus she na ;
translated: From what is it included?

original: 'dul ba rgya mtsho las ni zhes bya ba smos te lus dang ngag gi 'khrul pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed cing khyad par du 'dis 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba rgya mtsho las ni zhes bya ba smos te lus dang ngag gi 'khrul pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed cing khyad par du 'dis 'dul bar byed pas na 'dul ba ste /
translated: The Vinaya is an ocean, because it purifies the mind from errors of body and speech, and because it especially tames.

original: de nyid rgya mtsho yin pas na rgya mtsho chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgya mtsho yin pas na rgya mtsho chen po'o //
translated: It is an ocean because it is like an ocean.üîΩJust as an ocean is very deep and difficult to fathom, so too is the Vinaya.

original: gang gi phyir rgya mtsho chen po shin tu zab pa dang / dpag par dka' ba de bzhin du 'dul ba yang yin pa'i phyir 'dul ba rgya mtsho zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgya mtsho chen po shin tu zab pa dang / dpag par dka' ba de bzhin du 'dul ba yang yin pa'i phyir 'dul ba rgya mtsho zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Vinaya ocean.

original: de'i phyir de las bsdus pa ni bshad pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las bsdus pa ni bshad pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is said that the Vinaya is a summary of the scriptures.

original: de skad du brjod pas 'di ni rang gi rnam par rtog pas sbyar ba ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pas 'di ni rang gi rnam par rtog pas sbyar ba ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: By saying this, he shows that this is not his own invention.

original: da ni rang gzhan bang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang dang gzhan gyi bya ba'i rku ba la khyad par med par ston par byed do /
analyzed: da ni rang gzhan bang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang dang gzhan gyi bya ba'i rku ba la khyad par med par ston par byed do /
translated: Now, he shows that there is no difference between stealing one's own and others' property, with the words now, one's own and others' messengers, and so on.

original: dge sbyong bdag nyid rku ba dang gzhan rkur bcug pa dang / bang chen gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang dge sbyong kho nas brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong bdag nyid rku ba dang gzhan rkur bcug pa dang / bang chen gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas rku bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang dge sbyong kho nas brkus pa yin no //
translated: All of these are thieves of the virtuous ones.

original: de la bdag nyid rku ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bya ba la ltos pa med par bdag nyid kho na rku bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid rku ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bya ba la ltos pa med par bdag nyid kho na rku bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this regard, the thief of the virtuous ones who steals for himself is one who steals for himself without regard to the actions of others.

original: gzhan dag gis rku bar byed pa ni bdag nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan byed par gyur pa'i sgo nas rku bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rku bar byed pa ni bdag nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan byed par gyur pa'i sgo nas rku bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The thief of the virtuous ones who steals through others is one who steals by means of others, having consecrated himself.

original: bang chen dag gis gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni bang chen gcig nas gcig ste /
analyzed: bang chen dag gis gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni bang chen gcig nas gcig ste /
translated: The thief of the virtuous ones who steals through messengers is one who steals by means of a series of messengers.

original: bang chen rku ba pos mngags pa ni lung phog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bang chen rku ba pos mngags pa ni lung phog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The messenger of a thief is one who is sent by a thief.

original: 'ga' zhig gam 'ga' zhig gi rdzas lkog tu gyur pa khyer la shog shig ces de la go bar byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gam 'ga' zhig gi rdzas lkog tu gyur pa khyer la shog shig ces de la go bar byas pa yin la /
translated: He is one who is understood to be saying, ‚ÄúGo and steal the property of such and such a person.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa ni bang chen gcig nas gcig yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bang chen gcig nas gcig yin no //
translated: The others are the relay runners.

original: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bang chen gcig nas gcig la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bang chen gcig nas gcig la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Those who are like this are called relay runners.

original: dang po'i bang chen dang dus phyis byung ba'i bang chen kun la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i bang chen dang dus phyis byung ba'i bang chen kun la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first runner and all the subsequent runners are to be considered.

original: de'i phyir bang chen gcig nas gcig la sogs pa de dag gis kyang rku bar byed na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bang chen gcig nas gcig la sogs pa de dag gis kyang rku bar byed na /
translated: Therefore, if the theft is committed by those relay runners,

original: gang des kyang brkus par 'gyur te bdag nyid 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang des kyang brkus par 'gyur te bdag nyid 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin gyi /
translated: then the one who instigated the theft is also a thief, not just the one who actually carried it out.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu gzhan byed par gyur pa dag gis @197b kyang brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu gzhan byed par gyur pa dag gis @197b kyang brkus pa yin no //
translated: But the others who were made to commit the theft by him are also thieves.

original: lam gyi sgra ni bang chen gcig nas gcig la sogs pas kyang zhes bya bar kyang gi don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi sgra ni bang chen gcig nas gcig la sogs pas kyang zhes bya bar kyang gi don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse should be understood to mean that the relay runners are also thieves.

original: da ni bang ba la sogs pa'i snod phug nas der bcug pa'i 'bru la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa phug nas der chud pa 'ju ba'i rdzas brkus na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni bang ba la sogs pa'i snod phug nas der bcug pa'i 'bru la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa phug nas der chud pa 'ju ba'i rdzas brkus na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, if one steals the grain, etc., that is placed in a granary, etc., or the liquid that is placed in a pot, etc., after having broken the container, how is it to be determined?

original: gzhi nas rgyun gyis rku bar byed pa na //
analyzed: gzhi nas rgyun gyis rku bar byed pa na //
translated: When one steals by means of a continuum from the basis,

original: kun du 'brel ba'i rgyun ni gcig nyid yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun du 'brel ba'i rgyun ni gcig nyid yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the continuum of the connected is one.

original: gzhi ni spyir 'bru'i snod dang 'ju ba'i rdzas kyi snod kyi spyi gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhi ni spyir 'bru'i snod dang 'ju ba'i rdzas kyi snod kyi spyi gzung ba yin no //
translated: The basis is the general object of the granary and the general object of the container of the liquid.

original: de la dang por bug pa btod nas 'bru la sogs pa 'dzag par gyur pa ni gzhi nas rgyun 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dang por bug pa btod nas 'bru la sogs pa 'dzag par gyur pa ni gzhi nas rgyun 'byung ba yin no //
translated: First, a hole is made and the grain, etc., is caused to flow out. This is the arising of the continuum from the basis.

original: de las rku ba ni rnam pa des rku ba na 'bru la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa de brkus ba yin no //
analyzed: de las rku ba ni rnam pa des rku ba na 'bru la sogs pa gcig tu gyur pa de brkus ba yin no //
translated: When one steals from that, by that method, one steals the grain, etc., that has become one.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: kun tu 'brel ba ste yang dag par 'brel ba'i 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni kun du 'brel ba'i rgyun no //
analyzed: kun tu 'brel ba ste yang dag par 'brel ba'i 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni kun du 'brel ba'i rgyun no //
translated: The continuum of the connected is the continuum of the grain, etc., that is completely connected, that is perfectly connected.

original: de brkus pa yin te /
analyzed: de brkus pa yin te /
translated: That is stealing.

original: dper na bang ba la sogs pa phug nas 'bru la sogs pa rku ba na dang po 'byung ba nas brtsams te tha mar byung gi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba de la dngos po tshang na dngos gzhir 'gyur la ma yin na dngos po jiüîΩlta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na bang ba la sogs pa phug nas 'bru la sogs pa rku ba na dang po 'byung ba nas brtsams te tha mar byung gi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba de la dngos po tshang na dngos gzhir 'gyur la ma yin na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if one steals grain and so on from a granary and so forth, then if the substance is complete, it becomes the actual basis from the beginning when it is removed up to the end when it is removed without interruption. If it is not complete, then it is like the substance.

original: yang na rgyun bcad pa de la rgyun 'chad pa re re la yang dngos po ma tshang na nyes byas chung ba kho na re rer 'gyur la 'on te gcig la yang dngos po tshang na dngos gzhi kho nar 'gyur bar rig par bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyun bcad pa de la rgyun 'chad pa re re la yang dngos po ma tshang na nyes byas chung ba kho na re rer 'gyur la 'on te gcig la yang dngos po tshang na dngos gzhi kho nar 'gyur bar rig par bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Or, if the continuum is severed, then for each interruption of the continuum, if the substance is incomplete, it is only a minor offense. But if even one is complete, it should be understood as the actual basis.

original: da ni de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas gcig pa nyid bstan pa bstan pa'i sgo nas rku ba ston par byed de /
analyzed: da ni de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas gcig pa nyid bstan pa bstan pa'i sgo nas rku ba ston par byed de /
translated: Now, in the same way, one color, one place, and so on, by teaching the teaching of one place, he shows stealing.

original: ji ltar gong du kun nas 'brel ba'i rgyun gcig nyid yin pa de ltar 'dir yang brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyis non pa'i gnas gcig pa nyid yin pa de bas na 'das par gyur na nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gong du kun nas 'brel ba'i rgyun gcig nyid yin pa de ltar 'dir yang brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyis non pa'i gnas gcig pa nyid yin pa de bas na 'das par gyur na nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as in the previous case, the continuity of the one who is bound is the same, so too here, the place that is occupied by the substance that is to be stolen is the same. Therefore, when it is past, there is an offense.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: kha dog gcig pa ste sngon po la sogs pa de dag ni kha dog gcig pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog gcig pa ste sngon po la sogs pa de dag ni kha dog gcig pa'o //
translated: It is of one color, such as blue, etc. Those are of one color.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference there?

original: ri mo ste rdo rgyus la sogs pa'i ri mo yin te /
analyzed: ri mo ste rdo rgyus la sogs pa'i ri mo yin te /
translated: It is a design, such as a line drawn with chalk, etc.

original: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni bang rim la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni bang rim la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is included in that is a step, etc.

original: de med pa ni bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is being free from that.

original: de la gzhan yang khyad par du byed pa ni mthon dman dang bral ba'i sa'i cha ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan yang khyad par du byed pa ni mthon dman dang bral ba'i sa'i cha ste /
translated: There, another distinction is made: a part of the ground that is free from high and low.

original: yan lag gang yin pa de gzhi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gang yin pa de gzhi mnyam pa'o //
translated: That is the even ground.

original: de'i phyir de la ji skad @198a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ji skad @198a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no offense if one steals that.

original: du bshad pa'i gnas gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rdzas bzhag pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: du bshad pa'i gnas gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rdzas bzhag pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: The place that is explained as one is the place of substantial establishment.

original: de las gzhan du bskyod par gyur na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan du bskyod par gyur na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one moves from that, one will incur the fault of being just like the thing, that is the meaning.

original: glang chen la sogs zhes bya la sogs pas srog chags kyi yan lag dag gnas nyid du brjod par byed de /
analyzed: glang chen la sogs zhes bya la sogs pas srog chags kyi yan lag dag gnas nyid du brjod par byed de /
translated: The limbs of living beings, such as the elephant, etc., are described as places.

original: glang po dang por byas pa'i gzhan rta dang ma he la sogs pa yin pa de bas na de'i'o //
analyzed: glang po dang por byas pa'i gzhan rta dang ma he la sogs pa yin pa de bas na de'i'o //
translated: The elephant is the first, and the others are the horse, buffalo, etc.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: mngon pa ste shes par gyur pa'i yan lag rtsib logs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni phyogs mngon par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa ste shes par gyur pa'i yan lag rtsib logs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni phyogs mngon par gyur pa'o //
translated: The place that is manifest, that is, the limbs such as the ribs, etc., whose characteristics are known, are the manifest places.

original: phyogs mthong bar ma gyur pas na phyogs ni mi mngon pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs mthong bar ma gyur pas na phyogs ni mi mngon pa ste /
translated: The place that is not manifest is the place that is not seen,

original: yang lag gsal por ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang lag gsal por ma gyur pa'o //
translated: that is, the limbs that are not clear.

original: sha dang khrag dang pags pa rgyas par gyur pa'i phyir de yang gnas gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sha dang khrag dang pags pa rgyas par gyur pa'i phyir de yang gnas gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: and the flesh, blood, and skin are extended, it is still one place.

original: ni'i sgra ni yang gi don yin gyi /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni yang gi don yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúagain.‚Äù

original: glang chen la sogs kyang zhes bya ba snga ma las bye brag tu byed pa'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: glang chen la sogs kyang zhes bya ba snga ma las bye brag tu byed pa'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not mean that the elephant, etc., are distinguished from the previous.

original: gzhan du na glang po che la sogs pa'i phyogs mi mngon pa kha dog tha dad pa ri mo dang ldan pa'i gnas kyang gnas gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na glang po che la sogs pa'i phyogs mi mngon pa kha dog tha dad pa ri mo dang ldan pa'i gnas kyang gnas gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the elephant, etc., would be one place, even though they are not visible, have different colors, and have different patterns.

original: ni'i sgra ma las khyad par du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ma las khyad par du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù distinguishes them from the cow, etc.

original: de lta na bshad ma thag pa'i kha dog gcig pa tsam gyis kyang gnas gcig pa nyid du thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na bshad ma thag pa'i kha dog gcig pa tsam gyis kyang gnas gcig pa nyid du thob par 'gyur te /

original: de lta ni ma yin pa de'i phyir don snga ma kho na rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin pa de'i phyir don snga ma kho na rigs pa yin no //
translated: But that is not the case. Therefore, the former meaning is correct.

original: dong gi nang gi 'bru gnas gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa la /
analyzed: dong gi nang gi 'bru gnas gcig pa nyid du ston par byed pa la /
translated: In the case of the grains in a granary, they are shown to be one place.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa de bas na 'bru gnas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa de bas na 'bru gnas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is used, the meaning is that the grains are the same in terms of their location.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: kha dog mtshungs pa ste rigs 'dra bar gyur pa'i 'bru'i yan lag gang yin pa de ni kha dog mtshungs cha can no //
analyzed: kha dog mtshungs pa ste rigs 'dra bar gyur pa'i 'bru'i yan lag gang yin pa de ni kha dog mtshungs cha can no //
translated: The grains are the same in color, that is, they are of the same type.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩdong gnas te dong ni bang ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu zhe na / dong gnas te dong ni bang ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: What is the difference?üîΩThe grains are in a bin, that is, in a particular container.

original: de na yod pa'i phyir dong na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de na yod pa'i phyir dong na gnas pa yin no //
translated: They are in a bin because they are in a bin.

original: de la 'dir yang de lta bur gyur pa yang zhes bya bar yang gi sgra blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir yang de lta bur gyur pa yang zhes bya bar yang gi sgra blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be supplied, as in ‚Äúalso in that way.‚Äù

original: kha dog mtshungs cha can 'di dang sngar gyi phyogs ni mi mngon pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: kha dog mtshungs cha can 'di dang sngar gyi phyogs ni mi mngon pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe previous position is not evident‚Äù is an illustration.

original: de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste //
analyzed: de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste //
translated: Therefore, the grains are the same in color and the same in location.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong du bshad pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gong du bshad pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o /
translated: The characteristics of all the above explanations should be understood in this way.

original: gal te de lta @198b yin na de gnyis ci'i phyir brjod de /üîΩde ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste //
analyzed: gal te de lta @198b yin na de gnyis ci'i phyir brjod de / de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste //
translated: If that is so, why are these two mentioned?

original: zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are understood by this statement: ‚Äúhaving the same color, the same location.‚ÄùüîΩThat is true, but still, some people are confused about the fact that animals such as elephants have different heights but are still the same.

original: bden te de lta na yang kha cig dag glang po che la sogs pa'i srog chags la mthon dman yod kyang gcig nyid du 'khrul par 'gyur ba dang / dong na gnas pa'i 'bru rigs tha dad pa dang 'dras su zin kyang gnas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden te de lta na yang kha cig dag glang po che la sogs pa'i srog chags la mthon dman yod kyang gcig nyid du 'khrul par 'gyur ba dang / dong na gnas pa'i 'bru rigs tha dad pa dang 'dras su zin kyang gnas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And some people think that even though the seeds in a granary are of different kinds, they are still in the same location.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba dang / yang gi sgra rjes su 'jug go //üîΩrtsa rnams kyis bkram pa ni rtsva rnams bkram pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba dang / yang gi sgra rjes su 'jug go // rtsa rnams kyis bkram pa ni rtsva rnams bkram pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúin that way‚Äù and ‚Äúalso‚Äù are to be supplied.üîΩThe grass is spread out by the roots.

original: de la rtsva rnams bkram pa khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtsva rnams bkram pa khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the grass and the roots?

original: gshibs pa ste bar ma chad par 'dab 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: gshibs pa ste bar ma chad par 'dab 'byor ba'o //
translated: They are contiguous, that is, they are not separated by anything else.

original: 'dra ba ni kha dog mtshungs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni kha dog mtshungs par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are similar, that is, they are of the same color.

original: de ltar rtsva rnams bkram pa yang gnas gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtsva rnams bkram pa yang gnas gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, the grass is spread out, but it is still in one place.

original: khyad par dag bstan nas spyi brjod par bya ba'i phyir gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par dag bstan nas spyi brjod par bya ba'i phyir gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having taught the particulars, in order to discuss the general, he says, ‚ÄúAnd so on for the others.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba dang yang gi sgra yang rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba dang yang gi sgra yang rjes su 'jug go //

analyzed: de ltar gzhan rdo brag la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par dpyad par bya ba ni rdo kha dog mtshungs pa dang / ri mo la sogs pa med pa nyid dang / mtho ba dang dma' ba la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid du dpyad par bya ste /

analyzed: sa g-yos pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid gnas nyid yin gyi sa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: da ni gzhan dag gi rdzas sman la sogs pas rnam par nyams par byas nas rku ba gnas skabs ci tsam na brkus par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, when is it that one steals the property of others, such as medicine, after having impaired it?

original: smras pa / sman dang sngags la sogs pas nyams par byas nas rku bar byed pa ni nyams par byas pa rku bar byed pa na'o //üîΩnyams byas ngo bo ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sman dang sngags la sogs pas nyams par byas nas rku bar byed pa ni nyams par byas pa rku bar byed pa na'o // nyams byas ngo bo ste /
translated: It is said: One who steals after having impaired it with medicine, spells, and so on, steals after having impaired it.üîΩThe nature of what is impaired

analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nyams byas ngo bo'o //

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /

analyzed: gser dang dngul ni gser dang dngul te /

analyzed: de nyid brkus pa yin par 'dong cing brku bar bya ba nyid du dgongs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //

analyzed: nyams par ma byas pa'i gnas sabs ni ma yin no //

analyzed: ni'i sgra ni snga ma las khyad par du byed pa'i don te /

original: ji ltar gong du /
analyzed: ji ltar gong du /

original: rku sems dang ni 'dod pa nyid //
analyzed: rku sems dang ni 'dod pa nyid //

translated: Thus, if one steals after moving it from its place without damaging the substance, then since the substance was not damaged, it is not stolen.

original: nyams par byas pa'i gnas skabs la rin thang tshang bar gyur na de'i tshe dngos gzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyams par byas pa'i gnas skabs la rin thang tshang bar gyur na de'i tshe dngos gzhir 'gyur la /

analyzed: ma yin na chung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nyams par byed pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas su rig par bya'o //

analyzed: lug la sogs pa la brgyab pas rku bar byed pa na / bsad par gyur bas sam /

analyzed: smras pa / lug la sogs pa dag bsad par gyur pa nyid kyis brkus par ni 'ga' zhig tu yang mi 'gyur gyi //

analyzed: 'on kyang dus phyis gnas nas bskyod pa na brkus pa yin pas 'di ni rku ba nyid kyi sbyor ba yin no //

original: gang la zhe na /

translated: If one has the intention to destroy here, then since one has the intention to waste, it should be known that it is a fault belonging to that.

original: dang ni brku bya gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa kho na ston par byed de brku bar bya ba ste dbrog par bya ba gcig nyid ni brku bya gcig dang gzhi ni brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: dang ni brku bya gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa kho na ston par byed de brku bar bya ba ste dbrog par bya ba gcig nyid ni brku bya gcig dang gzhi ni brku bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi gnas yin te /

analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i gcig nyid ni gzhi'i rnam pa gcig nyid yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar bshad pa ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gzhi nas rgyun gyis rku bar byed pa na /

original: de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste /
analyzed: de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig ste /

analyzed: bdag po dpyad pa dang / rdzas dpyad pa dang / gnas dpyad pa dang / rku ba'i sbyor ba dpyad pa'o //

analyzed: de la rdzas dpyad pa ni /
translated: The analysis of substance is

analyzed: gser dngul rnam pa nyams byas rku byed na //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gnas dpyad pa ni de ltar kha dog gcig pa gnas gcig pa @199b ste /
translated: if one steals in that way, with the same color and in the same location,üîΩand so on. The analysis of the application of stealing is

analyzed: da ni nor gyi bdag po mi 'am ri dgas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag po'i rnam pa ston par byed de /

analyzed: rgyun la sogs pa'i nor brku bar bya ba'i bdag po dbang ba ni nor bdag ste /

analyzed: ri dgas la sogs pa dang de'i bdag po dag yin no //

analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i gos dang snod la sogs pa de la bdag gi med pa yin no //

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /

analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na / de las zhes smos te ltos pa med pa'i rgyu de'i phyir rkun po de las nan gyis te /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bsam pas len pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that there is no downfall if one takes it through one‚Äôs own intention.

analyzed: gzhan dag gi bsam pa med par ji ltar na tha mar 'gyur /

analyzed: mkhan po la bdag gir bya ba med pa yin no //

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /

original: 'dir zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes smos pa yin te /
